title: Managing Sports Injuries - From Treatment, Rehabilitation and Injuries Prevention
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course is designed to give students a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of sports injuries – their causes, mechanisms, assessments, treatments and rehabilitation with specific emphasis on recent advances in diagnosis and management skills. Focus will be placed on sports injuries of upper and lower limb.

title: Strategies in Sports Performance Enhancement
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of physiological, psychological and biomechanical theories and practice techniques applied to enhance sports performance. Topics include the study of contemporary issues in sports medicine and health science, biomechanics of human movement, exercise physiology and metabolism, exercise training principle and exercise prescription, sport nutrition for health and performance.

title: Revisits of Applied Sports Science
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to provide an introduction of theoretical principles and practical techniques related to the application of sport sciences. It focuses on the value and purpose of sport in society and the factors that affect participation and performance in sport and exercise. Topics include sports sociology, sports psychology, sports and recreational management and study of sportswear.

title: Orthopaedic Sports Medicine
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course is designed to give students a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of sports injuries – their causes, mechanisms, assessments and treatments with specific emphasis on recent advances in diagnosis and management skills.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the causes and mechanisms of common sports injuries; and consolidate essential injury prevention knowledge and skills.

title: Sports Injury Prevention and Rehabilitation
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to develop a comprehensive and interdisciplinary approach to prevention, treatment and management of sports injuries. Clinical knowledge, practical skills for evidence-based practice in sports medicine are provided. Through a combination of formal classroom and clinical experience, injury prevention strategies and rehabilitation management are introduced in this course.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the factors and mechanisms that affect participation and tactics for preventing sports injuries.

instructors:
Miss FU Fung Huen, 
Professor YUNG Shu Hang Patrick

title: Applied Sports Science for Performance Enhancement
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of physiological, psychological and biomechanical theories and practical techniques applied to enhance sports performance. Exercise physiology, sports nutrition, sports psychology and some popular issues such as sports participation in extreme environments are covered.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify and apply the physiological, psychological and biomechanical theories for enhancing sports performance.

title: Medical Problems Encountered During Exercise and Sports Participation
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to demonstrate significant depth of knowledge of the medical aspects of sports medicine. It focuses on the identification and treatment of medical conditions of cardiovascular system, respiratory system, endocrine system, urinary and neurological system associated with physically active individuals and athletes.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the medical problems that occur during exercises; and deal with medical situations appropriately.

title: Sports Medicine in Elite Athletes
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to give students a comprehensive understanding on the application of sports medicine in elite athletes. It focuses on rehabilitation and injury prevention that allow athletes to recover fully from previous injuries and that develop strategies to prevent injuries from re-occurring in the future.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to maximize the overall gain in performance of elite athletes; and evaluate any injuries or conditions that may occur on elite athlete.

title: Physical Fitness and Health: Theories and Application
description: This course aims to teach students the theories about health related value and benefits of exercise. Students will be exposed to concepts relating to the basic components of physical fitness; how fitness relates to maintain physical fitness and body health; what role fitness has with respect to preventive medicine and lifestyle modification.

title: Sports Medicine in Special Populations
description: This course will cover the following topics: exercise in childhood, exercise and aging, exercise and the disables and the female athletics triad. It will provide the knowledge required to set up and monitor suitable programmes for special groups of people who could be at risk when exercising unsupervised.

title: Environmental Sports Medicine
description: Weather conditions affect individuals' psychological framework and sports performance. This course aims to study the effect of enviromental factors on sports performance, topics of study include: exercise in high altitude, exercise in the cold, exercise in atmospheric pollution, heatstroke and hypothermia during exercise, exercise performance and intercontinental travel.

title: Medical Care of the Elite Athlete
description: This course aims to provide students with the knowledge of common medical conditions in elite athletes, the implications of exercise testing for prediction of athletic performance. After completion of the course, students should have acquired knowledge in the prevention, evaluation, care, and rehabilitation of injury and overtraining athletics.

title: Emergency Sports Medicine
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to provide comprehensive knowledge and practical skills in the assessment, treatment and management of emergent sports injuries. Emergent sports medicine management skills, emergency procedures, and advanced assessment skills, care and management of the specific injuries including head, spine, thoracic, and musculo-skeletal injuries are covered.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify, evaluate and handle any injuries or conditions that may occur during sports events.

title: Sports Psychology
description: The aim of this course is to provide students with an overview of the theories and applications involved in sport psychology discipline. Major areas of interest will include the motivational theories of sport participation, the factors that influence athletic performance, psychological techniques that can be used to improve sport athletic performance and the social psychology of sport. Students should be able to: 1) learn how to use psychological principles to enhance exercise performance; and 2) understand how participation in sport, exercise, and physical activity affects psychological development, health, and well being in all stages of life.

title: Sports Physiotherapy
description: Sports Physiotherapy is becoming accepted as a recognized specialty within physiotherapy. The aim of this course is to provide an opportunity for students to develop advanced theoretical and applied skills in sports physiotherapy. Emphasis will be on specificity in the manipulative physiotherapy approach, pre-manipulative screening and the ability to select and execute appropriate techniques to help injured persons return to sport.

title: Research Seminar
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course will require students to do critical readings on selected topics relevant to the thesis work in order to broaden theoretical or methodological bases of the thesis research. Armed with research knowledge gained from previous courses, students will be expected to develop a protocol for their master theses.

title: Research Project and Writing up of Thesis
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Independent study in a designated subject under the supervision of a faculty member; students are required to review the literature of their fields of interest and write up a report to form the master thesis.

title: Sports Medicine Seminar and Clinical Training
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine & Health Sciences
description: To further widen the exposure of students and enable them to apply knowledge and skills they learnt from previous courses, This course is designed to provide students with the valuable opportunities of clinical attachment, under the supervision of experienced doctors with expertise in sports medicine. Moreover, students will have the chances to attend relevant educational courses launched by reputable regional and international sports medicine and sports sciences related organizations.

title: Sports Medicine Seminars & Clinical Trainings
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to widen the exposure of students and enable them to apply knowledge and skills they have learnt. It offers opportunities for students to attend various academic symposia throughout their study period and to have clinical attachment in the sports injury clinic.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to learn the latest development of sports medicine industry.

title: Team Doctor / Physiotherapist (I)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course is designed for doctors and physiotherapists. It aims to provide students with comprehensive team physician training. Students are able to learn and practice through workshops and on-field training in local and overseas mega sports events and sports competitions.The module runs across two semesters. Students will have in-house training in semester one, and attend on-field training in semester two.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the role of team physician and team physiotherapist; and consolidates the assessment, treatment and rehabilitation skills of sports injuries.
syllabus: Students will learn and practice the role of team physician and on-field medical management at pitch side.

instructors:
Miss FU Fung Huen, 
Professor YUNG Shu Hang Patrick

title: Team Doctor / Physiotherapist (II)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Details please refer to ORTY5041 Team Dr / Physio (I).
outcome: Details please refer to ORTY5041 Team Dr / Physio (I).
syllabus: Students will learn the on-field medical management at pitch side through workshops and on-field training in mega sports events and local/overseas sports competitions.

title: Strength and Conditioning Coach (I)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course is co-organized by CUHK and Hong Kong Sports Institute. Students are able to practise the most advanced and scientific training for elite athletes for the best strength and conditioning. Students are able to make use of the knowledge gained to design a training plan and coach an athlete at the end of semester.This elective runs across two semesters. Students will have in-house training in semester one (SCC I), and conduct a training programme in semester two (SCC II).
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the role of strength and conditioning coach; and consolidates the assessment and training techniques.

instructors:
Miss FU Fung Huen, 
Professor YUNG Shu Hang Patrick

title: Strength and Conditioning Coach (II)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Details please refer to SCC (I).
outcome: Details please refer to SCC (I).

title: Research Project (I)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Students are required to conduct an independent research project. The module instructor and the project supervisors will guide the students to read latest related literature and formulate the research question, and then design the method and conduct sample size estimation. After collecting the data, students are required to perform statistical analysis, interpret the data, discuss the findings to answer the research hypothesis and write up a thesis.The elective runs across two semesters. Students have to design the research question and methodology in semester one, and collect the data and write up a thesis in semester two.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to learn how to conduct a scientific research; and write up a publishable paper.

title: Research Project (II)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Details please refer to Research Project (I).
outcome: Details please refer to Research Project (I).

title: Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Students are required to conduct a review on a specific topic related to sports medicine and health science. The review would be a systematic review or a meta-analysis, depending on the nature of the studies being systematically reviewed by the student. The module instructors will guide the students to utilize the literature search engine to conduct a scientific systematical search, to quantitatively evaluate the quality of the paper to determine inclusion, and to synthesize the summarized data and present the results. The elective runs across two semesters. Students have to design the project and methodology in semester one (Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis I), and synthesize the data and write up a publishable articles in semester two (Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis II).
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to learn how to conduct a Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis; and write up a publishable paper.

title: Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (II)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Details please refer to Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I)
outcome: Details please refer to Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I).

title: Clinical Sports Trainer (I)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course focuses on injury prevention, evaluation and acute care of sports injuries. Students will take up the role in bridging coaches, players and health care professionals in sports teams and will assist coaches in training. Students are able to learn through lectures, workshops and on-field training in various sports events.The elective runs across two semesters. Students will have in-house training in semester one (CST I), and attend on-field training in semester two (CST II).
outcome: By the end of this course, students will be able to identify the role of clinical sports trainer; and consolidate the assessment, treatment and rehabilitation skills.

instructors:
Miss FU Fung Huen, 
Professor YUNG Shu Hang Patrick

title: Clinical Sports Trainer (II)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Science
description: Details please refer to Clinical Sports Trainer (I)
outcome: Details please refer to Clinical Sports Trainer (I)

title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in MPhil Orthopaedics and Traumatology
description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignment for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis
outcome: After finishing this course, to help students become more independent, confident and efficient learners

instructors:

requirements: For students in MPhil Orthopaedics and Traumatology
description: To present a seminar summarizing research work performed in the previous term/year.
outcome: After finishing this course, to help student understand, synthesize, analyze the major study themes
